section.section: A claimant aggrieved by a final determination of the Board may file a petition for judicial review in the circuit court of the county where the injury occurred or where the claimant resides.
The Board may be a party to the action.

text.section:
The circuit court may:
affirm the Board's determination;
reverse or modify a determination it finds to be arbitrary or unreasonable; or
remand the case and direct the Board to consider the matter further or make additional findings of fact.
The claimant or the Board may appeal a decision of the circuit court to the Court of Special Appeals.
